how did you start your afternoon ??

paragraphs.text: You can’t be your team’s bottleneck. You need to coach and mentor your team members to be able to tackle all technical challenges without your help. You should never be needed to write production code. A great use of your coding time is the non-feature dirty work. Make the build faster, extract some shared behavior into a nice library. Look for things that will make things more productive or more fun for the team. You can also keep your technical skills by focusing on coding Proofs Of Concepts, explore new technologies for your team to use, or work on side projects within the company or on your own.
paragraphs.name: dcc0
a0cc
paragraphs.text: As a manager you are not building a product, you are building a team that knows how to build products. Thus, making your team succesful should be your primary goal and metric to evaluate yourself against. If you lead a successful team of happy engineers, the team’s success will speak by itself and you will need to spend less time in meetings trying to explain or sell your achievements to your peers and superiors.

paragraphs.name: a4f0
paragraphs.text: Another challenge for me was being too vocal or expressing my opinions too strongly when the team was discussing how to tackle technical problems. I was unaware of this problem until a team member let me know during an open feedback session with the whole team. She said something like “You are too opinionated during our technical discussions… you should give more room to others”
Thank you for sharing. I think most who grow into the role face this and 👍 to your good friend’s advice!
paragraphs.name: 72d7

paragraphs.text: Runway improvements
paragraphs.name: 011b

paragraphs.text: Joan Gamell

I could not have stated this better myself. In the spirit of optimization and providing the ideal environment for delegation, this is something I am trying to do more by creating road maps for my developer value-adds: Prioritized features that do not affect consumers but make the team more productive or less error prone.

paragraphs.text: This is sound advice — thank you. As an engineering manager, I totally agree you need to give the team the cool design and coding work — the way I keep my tech chops and my understanding of how systems have been coded is to write some of the instrumentation and telemetry for them, and help solve some of the tricky performance issues. 1baef05e511f.title: Another trick for making tooling decisions and technical choices is to leave it to focus groups…

paragraphs.text: Another trick for making tooling decisions and technical choices is to leave it to focus groups that meet across teams to decide best practices and tools. Then with agreement, the team creates gitbook and anyone with a valid change can submit a PR and have the team review it.
